t: History of Amazon - Wikipedia
s: 2 weeks ago - Bezos finally decided that his new business would sell books online, because of the large worldwide demand for literature, the low unit price for books, and the huge number of titles available in print. Amazon was founded in the garage of Bezos' rented home in Bellevue.

t: 6 $25 Billion Companies That Started in a Garage | Inc.com
s: February 6, 2020 - Amazon.com is a well-known online shopping website that was created in 1994 as an online bookstore by Jeff Bezos. He created the website in his garage in Washington, originally investing nearly $40,000 to enable him to order, sell, and deliver books to 48 different countries.

t: How Does Amazon Key In-Garage Delivery Work? - Amazon Customer Service
s: Amazon Key In-Garage Delivery is a convenient, secure, and easy way to have Amazon packages and groceries delivered inside your garage. It's exclusive for Prime members and works with Amazon, Amazon Fresh, Whole Foods Market, and Subscribe and Save deliveries.

t: Set Up In-Garage Delivery in the Amazon Shopping App - Amazon Customer Service

t: Amazon at 20 years: From garage startup to global technology powerhouse – GeekWire
s: July 9, 2014 - In July 1994 — 20 years ago this month — Jeff Bezos officially established the company that would come to be known as Amazon.com, setting up shop in the garage of his rental house on a winding suburban road in Bellevue, Wash., east of Seattle.

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 3 days ago - Bezos also considered several other options, including Portland, Oregon, and Boulder, Colorado. The company, originally named Cadabra, was founded in the converted garage of Bezos's house for symbolic reasons and was renamed to Amazon in November 1994.
